snippet: Fear about government debt has put the brakes on much American infrastructure investment, even when the future benefits far outweigh the repayment costs.
abstract: Robert H Frank Economic View column contends fear about government debt has put the brakes on much American infrastructure investment, even when future benefits far outweigh  repayment costs; cites Germany's infrastructure spending as example to follow for economic revival.
lead_paragraph: Fear about government debt has put the brakes on much American infrastructure investment, even when the future benefits far outweigh the repayment costs.
